availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John C. Baker (Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier (U.S.A.))

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier (U.S.A.). Kentucky native. Son of Isaac Baker and Mary Baker. Married to Martha Catharine Gibson Baker in Union County, Kentucky, on September 1, 1856. Father of Thomas J. Baker, Cornelia H. Baker, and Nelson G. Baker. Resident in Hopkins County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Webster County, Kentucky, in 1860. Served in the 9th Kentucky Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and a wagoner from August 7, 1862, to August 21, 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, District 2, p. 116A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, Dixon, p. 544.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, District 2, p. 176B.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0095.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Union County Marriages, Film 000562202.
